intro: Silene dionysii var. elata, commonly known as the tall redstem sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, pink to reddish-purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The species is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
